enumValues.description: Period represents a period of time in and contains the salary for that period.
enumValues.name: ANNUAL

types.description:
A payscale containing a specific level and agreed pay rates for a period of time and pay steps.
This would contain all data for an EC-04, for example, including the changes to pay according to the collective agreeement
and the annual pay steps within the specific agreement.
Of note, many payScales are behind the current date and/or are being negotiated at any point in time.

fields.description: The name of the payscale, e.g.: EC-04
fields.name: name

fields.description: The level of the payscale as an integer, e.g.: 4
fields.name: level

fields.description: The number of steps in a payscale - e.g., there are 5 steps in the EC-04 payscale
fields.name: steps

fields.description:
The rates of pay in a specific payscale.
E.g., the EC-04 payscale has seven adjustments between June 22, 2017 and June 22, 2021.
Each rate of pay consists of a date that it comes into force, a number of steps and a salary for each step.
fields.name: ratesOfPay

fields.description:
Returns the rate of pay for today's date.
Checks today's date against the effective date of a rate of pay and potential future rates of pay.
This returns the rates of pay that are currently active for the payscale.
fields.name: currentRatesOfPay

types.name: PayScale

types.description: A pay group as defined by a collective agreement

fields.description: The Group's name as per the collective agreement.
fields.name: name

fields.description: The two-letter identifier for the group as an enum.
fields.name: identifier

fields.description: The URL for the collective agreement.
fields.name: url

fields.description: Vector of payscales for the group.
fields.name: payscales

fields.description: Date the collective agreement was scraped in YYYY-MM-DD.
fields.name: dateScraped

fields.description: Returns a payscale for a specific level within the group.
fields.name: payscaleForLevel

fields.description:
Returns a vector of PayPeriods representing the expected pay for a range of work days inclusive of two YYYY-MM-DD dates.
For example, start_date: "2020-05-01" and end_date: "2020-05-05" would return pay for 1 day of 7.5 hours.
The function returns work days and holidays (for which public servants receive pay), but not weekends.
Also requires a level and step in integers to compute the requested pay.
fields.name: payAtLevelAndStepBetweenDates

fields.description:
Directly returns the today's in force salary for a level and step within the group
without needing to access pay scales and rates of pay.
Accepts level and step as integers as arguments.
fields.name: payInForceForLevelAndStep

fields.description:
Directly returns the pay at a specified date for a level and step within the group
without needing to access pay scales and rates of pay.
Accepts level and step as integers and date in a YYYY-MM-DD string as arguments.
fields.name: payOnDateForLevelAndStep

types.name: Group

types.description:
GraphQL type kind

The GraphQL specification defines a number of type kinds - the meta type of a type.

enumValues.description:
## Scalar types

Scalar types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries. Strings, numbers, and booleans are the built in types, and while it's possible to define your own, it's relatively uncommon.
enumValues.name: SCALAR

enumValues.description:
## Object types

The most common type to be implemented by users. Objects have fields and can implement interfaces.
enumValues.name: OBJECT

enumValues.description:
## Interface types

Interface types are used to represent overlapping fields between multiple types, and can be queried for their concrete type.
enumValues.name: INTERFACE

enumValues.description:
## Union types

Unions are similar to interfaces but can not contain any fields on their own.
enumValues.name: UNION

enumValues.description:
## Enum types

Like scalars, enum types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries.
enumValues.name: ENUM

enumValues.description:
## Input objects

Represents complex values provided in queries _into_ the system.
enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT

enumValues.description:
## List types

Represent lists of other types. This library provides implementations for vectors and slices, but other Rust types can be extended to serve as GraphQL lists.
enumValues.name: LIST

enumValues.description:
## Non-null types

In GraphQL, nullable types are the default. By putting a `!` after a type, it becomes non-nullable.
enumValues.name: NON_NULL

types.name: __TypeKind

types.description:
IMPORTANT: IN TESTING
A Pay Period represents a series of time periods and the approximate gross pay expect in each period
It is based on the pay rate in force for the dates in question at a current level and step.
If you want to track different steps, you will need to run multiple instances of PayAtLevelAndStepBetweenDates
in your query.

fields.description: The start date for a pay period in YYYY-MM-DD.
fields.name: startDate

fields.description: The end date for a pay period in YYYY-MM-DD.
fields.name: endDate

fields.description: The duration in hours for a pay period.
fields.name: workHours

fields.description: The duration in days for a pay period.
fields.name: workDays

fields.description: The hourly pay rate for a pay period.
fields.name: hourlyRate

fields.description: The annual pay rate for a pay period.
fields.name: annualRate

fields.description: The gross salary (approximate) for a pay period
fields.name: salary

types.name: PayPeriod

types.description:
A Rate of Pay for a collective agreement at a point in time across several pay steps.
Includes a date_time for when the rate of pay comes into force and an array of salary steps.

fields.description: The date_time at which a rate of pay comes into force.
fields.name: inForce

fields.description: The range of salary steps within a rate of pay. An array of integers.
fields.name: salary

types.name: RateOfPay

enumValues.description: GroupID represents a two-letter identifier for a pay group as an enum
enumValues.name: CS
